dcterms:creator: Ashish Kumar
Harshit Tomar
Virender Kumar Mehla
Rama Komaragiri
Manjeet Kumar
dcterms:description: The electrocardiogram data was recorded in the Cardiology Department of Jiangsu Provincial People’s Hospital in China. Each sample consists of 12-channel data with 10,000 time points. It includes data from 871 atrial fibrillation patients, capturing their daily electrocardiograms and continuous monitoring of their subsequent lives, there are 143 positive samples and 622 negative samples. A positive result indicates the occurrence of a stroke in the following period, while a negative result means no stroke occurred.
dcterms:title: ECG Dataset

dcterms:creator: Nitesh V. Chawla
Kevin W. Bowyer
Lawrence O. Hall
W. Philip Kegelmeyer
dcterms:description: The SMOTE data augmentation algorithm was utilized to create synthetic samples for the minority class rather than simply duplicating minority class samples. It achieves this by randomly selecting a minority class sample and one of its k nearest neighbors.
dcterms:title: SMOTE Data Augmentation Algorithm

dcterms:creator: A. Gaˇzov´a

dcterms:description: The CHA2DS2-VASc scoring system is used to assess and reduce the stroke risk in patients with atrial fibrillation based on several factors, such as age, gender, presence of hypertension, or diabetes.
dcterms:title: CHA2DS2-VASc Scoring System

dcterms:creator: Mark E. Silverman
dcterms:description: The Atrial Fibrillation Patients Dataset includes data from patients with atrial fibrillation, which is crucial for understanding the condition and its implications.
dcterms:title: Atrial Fibrillation Patients Dataset
